alert.note: Alert for Columbia; McDuffie; Richmond (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 7:48PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of McDuffie, Columbia and Richmond Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 747 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Camak to near Thomson. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... North Augusta, Grovetown, Evans, Thomson, Martinez, Fort Gordon, Augusta, Hephzibah, Harlem, Appling, Glendale, South Augusta, Midtown, Riverwood, Summerville, Wrightsboro, Augusta Mall, Daniel Field, Augusta Regional Airport and Village Plaza Shopping Center. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in Georgia between mile markers 167 and 201. Interstate 20 in South Carolina near mile marker 0. Interstate 520 in Georgia between mile markers 1 and 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
